modules.description: This module defines comparison operations for arbitrary-precision integers (`Z.t`), including equality, ordering, and inequality checks. It supports direct comparisons between large integers without loss of precision, enabling accurate logic in numerical computations. Use cases include implementing conditional logic in cryptographic algorithms, validating numerical ranges in formal verification, and sorting or deduplicating large integer values in data processing pipelines.

This module offers arithmetic operations (addition, multiplication, exponentiation), bitwise manipulations, and comparison functions for arbitrary-precision integers represented as `Z.t` values. It supports conversions between `Z.t` and numeric types like integers, floating-point numbers, and strings, while enabling efficient digit counting and sign checks. It is suitable for cryptographic algorithms, large-scale numerical computations, and scenarios requiring exact arithmetic beyond machine word limits.

Implements arbitrary-precision rational numbers using arbitrary-precision integers (Z.t), supporting construction, arithmetic operations (addition, multiplication, exponentiation), IEEE-compliant comparisons, and special value handling (infinities, undefined
